headline: Kari Lake triggered by Jan. 6 questions from '60 Minutes' in Australia — and storms off the set
author: Sarah K. Burris
sentences:
She ends up storming off the set.pic.twitter.com/Jmat6BTS1l

“Donald Trump said the accused [over the Capitol Riots] should be forgiven.

Trump supporters encounter police in Washington January 6 as they attempt to breach a police barrier (pictured) in front of the Capitol building, a symbol of US democracy
More than 700 people have been charged in the Capitol Riots and most have been released
“Maybe they’ll get away with it in Australia because you gave away your rights.

You have no freedom, you have melted down all your weapons.’
“We do things differently here in America, we have something called the Constitution and we have rights.”
NOW WATCH: Former KGB agent says Putin was nothing more than a 'mid-level bureaucrat'
Former KGB agent says Putin was nothing more than a 'mid-level bureaucrat'

Since the riots, 786 people have been arrested and charged with crimes, with an analysis by The Guardian showing that 70 percent have been released on bail, far more than the typical 25 percent rate for federal indictees.
The storming of the Capitol left at least five dead and 140 police officers injured and followed a fiery speech by Trump to thousands of his supporters near the White House.
Trump was impeached by the House of Representatives for a second historic time after the Capitol riots and charged with inciting a riot, but was acquitted by the Senate.
Arizona gubernatorial candidate Kari Lake showed she wasn't ready for prime time when a '60 Minutes' reporter interviewed her for the Australia show on Sunday.
Republicans have had a hard time dealing with the questions about Jan. 6 and it appears they still haven't come up with a way to explain it away.

See the video below:
Trump-endorsed AZ Gov candidate Kari Lake sat down for interview with \u201860 Minutes Australia,\u2019 which aired tonight.
Liam Bartlett asked Lake about Donald Trump saying that he would pardon those who participated in the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol.
Your man, Donald — your man, Donald, brought it up," speaking to the fact that Trump was part of the GOP and had endorsed Lake.
Things when downhill fast when she was asked if she agreed with Trump that J6 defendants should get pardoned.
It was a legitimate question, but Lake was too triggered by the phrasing of the question.

You're trying to twist that to make me look bad.”
"You're a Republican," said Bartlett.
The two talked over each other with, Bartlett repeating, "well that's not true at all.
“People are being held in prison without charge, it’s un-American,” Ms. Lake said.
It's obvious you've come into this and you don't like President Donald Trump."
“Well, that really has nothing to do with being Governor of Arizona.
It devolved from there, with Lake ultimately walking off the set.
He noted that Trump said that the 2020 election was a lie.
Do you think they should be pardoned," Bartlett asked.
She has declared herself part of the Republican Party.
"It’s just — it’s obvious you’ve come into this.
"It’s just the flippant attitude," Lake whined.
He explained that Trump is a Republican leader.

That’s just so disrespectful," she replied.

His personal endorsement," said Bartlett.
I'm running for governor," Lake dodged.

I wasn’t there," she replied.
"He's the Republican leader."
